results.title: The Man with a movie camera: fragments from a cameraman's diary
results.brief_description:
The film’s protagonist is a cameraman travelling through the city involving himself in its daily dawn-to-dusk activities and observing all walks of life through the eye of his camera. Although Vertov’s film has been linked with the so-called ‘city symphonies’, Vertov is not concerned with the abstract formalism of films like Berlin but with a philosophical reflection on the power of the camera over ‘reality’. Vertov rejected the contemporary fiction film in favour of recording unstaged ‘reality’, what he called ‘instants of life’. Yet his concern was also with the nature of cinematographic illusion. He constantly reminds the audience of the camera’s presence and of the film being edited and screened. As such his influence extends across the filmmaking spectrum from cinema verite’s preoccupation with unstaged reality to experimental self-reflexiveness and the preoccupation of filmmakers like Godard with the ideology of representation. Also available on 16mm and VHS.

Credits: Director, script, Dziga Vertov ; photographer, Mikhail Kaufman.

results.title: Circling the globe in comfort
results.creator_credit: Jaaf Nieuwenhuis and Royal Rotterdam Lloyd
results.brief_description: Historical documentary of a round-the-world trip by the 23,000 ton Dutch liner, the “Willem Ruys”, beginning from Sydney and calling into Wellington (NZ), Lima (Peru), Balboa (Panama City), Miami, Bermuda, Southampton, Rotterdam, passing Portugal, Gibraltar and Malta to Port Said and into the Suez Canal. From the Suez Canal the voyage then continues on through the Red Sea to aden, into the Indian Ocean to Colombo, then Singapore, across the Equator past Java and Christmas Island to Cape Leeuwin and finally arriving in Melbourne.

results.title: Angry Boy
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby, Alexander Hammid and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: An analysis of the emotional disturbance of a boy whose hostility finds expression in terms of stealing. Through the help of a child guidance clinic, this hostility is traced back to the source in the home life of the child where a good and well-intentioned mother has been taking out her hostility toward her mother and her husband in an over-protective attitude toward the child. The film then develops as it describes the process in which the child is helped by guidance personnel in his way to recovery. Cinematography by Peter Glushanok.

results.title: Davis Cup, 1956
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitchurch and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: Edited action footage of all the matches in the 1956 David Cup Final between Australia and USA. Australia won all matches to make it its 13th Davis Cup victory and was represented by Lew Hoad and Ken Rosewall and USA by Victor Seixas, Herbert Flam and Sam Giammalva. Contains footage of historical interest including Robert Menzies in various spectator shots, Harry Hopman receiving Davis cup from Richard Nixon, then Vice President, for 1955 victory.
